definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: It's good to help children and old people to cross the road.
sentences.chinese: 帮助小孩和老人过马路是一种助人为乐的行为。

sentences.english: Thirdly, , I enjoy listening to this helpful friend.
sentences.chinese: 第三，我喜欢倾听这位助人为乐的朋友。

sentences.english: "Do good" she always said--and be there for others.
At school, I'm be polite and helpful.
sentences.chinese: 在学校，我很有礼貌和助人为乐。

sentences.english: There is a kind of people that I appreciate so much.
sentences.chinese: 有一种人我很欣赏，那就是助人为乐的人。

sentences.english: This is altruism, seeking pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 这叫助人为乐，帮助别人自己乐呵吧。

definition: to pick up money and not hide it (idiom); to return property to its owner
to see what is right and act courageously (idiom, from Analects); to stand up bravely for the truth/acting heroically in a just cause
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
respect the old and cherish the young
to abandon self for others (idiom); to sacrifice oneself to help the people/altruism
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
to help the poor/almsgiving for the needy/to assist poor households or poor regions
